result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arnold C Gustafson

records.addlTxt:
11:49 AM cases 22CF330, 22CF364, 22CF407, 22CF851 called. Defendant Arnold C Gustafson in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Arnold C Gustafson.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties stipulate to the competency report. Court finds defendant is competent to proceed. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense recites the joint agreement. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1 as charged in the Information. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
90 days in Jail with Huber all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
No contact with S.K., her residence or place of employment. 
Defendant not to be within one mile of Care Partners Assisted Living. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to pay court costs including DNA sample surcharge. 
State does not object to probation ending after 2 years if there are no violations of conditions and the probation agent deems it appropriate.

(9:14 AM cases 22CF330, 22CF364, 22CF407, 22CF851 called.) Defendant Arnold C Gustafson in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Arnold C Gustafson. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
State is objecting to any modification of bond and provides reasoning to the Court.
Attorney Rivard makes argument for bond modification.
State makes further argument in opposition of bond modification request.
Court orders the motion for bond modification is denied.
Cases will proceed for Competency Hearing as scheduled.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on September 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.

(2:02 PM cases 22CF330, 22CF364, 22CF407, 22CF851 called.) Defendant Arnold C Gustafson in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Arnold C Gustafson. Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rivard advises there had been an offer to conclude the 3 oldest cases but does not include the newest case.
Attorney Rivard advises there has been a competency examination ordered in Chippewa County for September 21, 2022.
Attorney Rivard is requesting a bail/bond hearing be scheduled.
Parties address competency and advise the exam in Chippewa County will not suffice for Eau Claire County cases.
State requests the Court order a competency examination be completed.
Attorney Rivard raises competency.
Court orders competency examination be completed.
Bail/Bond Hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 9:15 am.
Competency Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Order Authorizing Furlough. 
See Order for details.
Dated 08/05/2022, Letter from ADA Winter to Court regarding stipulation for temporary release.

(4:03 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Arnold C Gustafson in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Arnold C Gustafson.
Attorney Rivard raises competency and advises it is currently being addressed in Chippewa County.
Parties request competency be raised in cases 22CF330, 22CF364, 22CF407 as well, which are currently out of intake.
Judge reviews the complaint and finds probable cause to believe crimes have been committed by the defendant. 
Court orders competency examination be completed.
Competency Hearing to be scheduled with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.
Attorney Rivard advises has no objection to the report being filed in Chippewa to be used for the Eau Claire County cases. 
Attorney Rivard waives Eau Claire County also conducting an examination and have the examination from Chippewa County being used in Eau Claire County.
State advises cannot use the examination from Chippewa County as the examination is based on each charge from each case.
Parties to draft a stipulation to be provided with Chippewa County examination.
Court orders is not ordering a separate examination be completed at this time in Eau Claire County.
Parties to schedule with Branch 5 in 35 days.
Attorney Rivard advises the defendant's spouse's funeral is scheduled for this Saturday and requests a bond modification to a signature bond.
State has no objection to a stipulation if provided with specific funeral details. State does object to a bond modification.
Court advises transportation is required for the defendant to attend the funeral and counsel is to submit a stipulation to the court. Court orders will not amend the bond.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Arnold C Gustafson appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Public Defender Intern Clayton Cavanaugh and supervising Attorney Ryan Kohler.
State requests $5,000 Cash Bond (continued no contact violations).  Court orders $1,000 Cash Bond.
State additionally requests the posted bonds in 22CF364 and 22CF407 be forfeited. Court forfeits the posted bond in 22CF407. 
Preliminary Hearing: 8/2/22 at 2:00 PM.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 8/10/22 at 3:30 PM.
STC: 8/19/22 at 2:00 PM (Br 5). 
Defense notes that competency was previously raised although a Competency Examination has not yet been ordered.
Clerk notes the Defendant has a pending Competency Examination in Chippewa County.

Conditions:
No contact with S.K. their residence, place of employment, not to be within 1 mile of Care Partners Assisted Living.
